result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
$1,279.00 payable to Kenneth L.
*01-09-2018/ Judge Pedro Colon               
The court vacates the previous restitution order and sets restitution at ZERO.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay Court costs, all applicable surcharges including  DNA, assessments AND restitution.  To be collected from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims and which the department determines is reasonable for the court costs and surcharges.  Balance to be paid during Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Bail on deposit to apply.

07-30-2019/ Judge Pedro Colon    
The Court ordered that the defendant is granted 16 days of sentence credit on counts one and two.     
****     

*July 26, 2019  Honorable Pedro A. Colon:  Orders the defendant's sentence modified to 7 years of Inital Confinement and 7 years of Extended Supervision on counts 1 and 2 concurrent to one another, consecutive to 2015CF2888.
Concurrent with: *7/26/2019   Concurrent with count two, consecutive to 2015CF2888.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with Kenneth L. or his residence.
No further violations of the law.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: *7/26/2019  Concurrent with count one, with 16 days of sentence credit.
consecutive to 2015CF2888

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.  Additional statements by Renee R. 

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 20 years, consecutive to Count 2 and any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 years. 

As to Count *:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 35 years, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 10 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 years. 

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol.
- No contact with Kenneth L. or his residence. 
- No further violations of the law. 
- Restitution set at $1,279.00 payable to Kenneth L., to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; balance to be paid during extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  TO BE PAID FIRST.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
- Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges,including DNA, and assessments to be collected by DOC from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable, balance due during extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY, remainder to be returned to poster. 
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sampleif not already done.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Received and Filed, Crime Victim Impact Statement and Restitution Worksheet.

defendant from Green Bay Correctional, signed and filed
Jury Instructions - Criminal - Statutory Definition of the Crime, Opening Instructions and other Instructions, Filed

Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in court, Pro Se, in custody.  Attorney Scott Anderson appears as Stand-by counsel. Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial continued.
Jury in the box.
Court instructs Jury.
Closing arguments heard.
Alternate Juror chosen by lot. 
Juror 5 is discharged from duty.
Court charges Jury.
Deputies Koch and Rosenstein sworn.
Jury out of the box at 12:09 p.m.
Court in recess for the lunch hour.
Deputy Koch informs the Court that the Jury has a question.
Back on the record.
Same appearances.
Court reads the question on the record.
Jury back in the box at 2:16 P.M.
On the same day, at the hour of 2:17 P.M., the Jury returned and by the foreperson brought in a verdict, which was read in open court.
AS TO COUNT 1 (FIRST DEGREE RECKLESS INJURY-USE OF A WEAPON): THE JURY FOUND THE DEFENDANT GUILTY.
AS TO COUNT 2 (FIRST DEGREE INTENTIONAL HOMIDIDE): THE JURY FOUND THE DEFENDANT GUILTY.
The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  
Jury discharged.
The Court denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdict and ordered that a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.
Defendant remanded into custody.
Matter set for Sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 1:30 before Judge Pedro Colon.
Jury verdict; Filed
Exhibit list; Filed

Held off the record. Case set for final pre-trial.  The Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings. Parties will address issues on Monday, 08/29/2016 at Jury Trial. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 08/29/2016 at 09:00 am, Branch 18.

Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in court pro-se with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson as standby counsel.  Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE FILE. Case calendared for a pre-trial conference. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defendant still awaiting discovery. State notes that some discovery was previously turned over to standby counsel, and remaining discovery is usually turned over on the day of trial. Court denied the defendant's motion to terminate Atty Anderson as standby counsel. State and standby defense counsel to provide copies of all discovery to defendant. Defendant examined as to his right to counsel and confirmed that he does not wish to have counsel. Case adjourned in branch 18.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in court with Attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Defendant Jerry Wayne Hurt in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a final pre-trial.  The Defendant has indicated he would like to proceed pro se.  The Court had colloquy with Defendant about representing himself, and allowed Attorney Givens to withdraw and allowed the Defendant to proceed in representing himself with Attorney Scott Anderson as an observer.  The Court appointed Attorney Scott Anderson to be stand by counsel for the Defendant at the County's expense.  The Court VACATED the March 14, 2016 Jury Trial date.  The Court ordered that all discovery must be turned over to the Defendant within 24-hours.

As to arraignment, the Defendant did NOT waive reading of the Amended Information and ADA Ringersma read the Amended Information and the Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  The Court ordered that the $15,000 cash bail is now amended to a $15,000 signature bond and the $10,000 cash on deposit is held for recompense.  The Defendant indicated he has motions that will be filed.  Matter set for a motion hearing on April 15, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
